intro: Onosma elwendica, commonly known as the Kashmiri blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and is typically found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its attractive, showy flowers that bloom in summer. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
